msDesc.head: Philippus de Monte Calerio, Dominicale. Germany, s. xiv2.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1179–1193. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Phillipus de Monte Calerio
msItem.title: Dominicale
msItem.note: Abbreviated version of text (ed.: Little 89, this copy only; Hauréau, Initia, 2. 202vb/203ra, this copy only; Mohan 135*, this copy only, & 390*f.; G. de Martel, Répertoire des texts Latins relatifs au livre de Ruth (VIIe–XVe s.), Instrumenta Patristica 18 (Steenbrugge, 1990) 107f. (C 53), citing the present MS. at p. 108). Text is imperfect, as there are one or more quires missing at the end. Collection fully itemized in the printed catalogue.

supportDesc.support: parchment; remnants of medieval repair (stitching holes).
supportDesc.foliation: i, 1–128 in modern (19th-cent.) pencil. no. 70 occurs four times (70, 70a–70c), nos 84 & 102 duplicated (84a & 84b; 102a & 102b), no. 117 occurs seven times (117a–117g).
supportDesc.collation: i 12 | ii–vii 10 | viii & ix 8 | x 10 | xi 8 | xii 14 | xiii 8 | xiv 10.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in ink and lead point, one column of c.40–50 both ruled and unruled lines. Ruled space c.182–191 125–28

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xiv2: seven hands, some of which write a cursive script; mostly below top line: 1) (fols 1r–41v, l. 36, 48v–53r, l. 3, & 71r–84av); 2) (fols 41v, l. 36–48r); 3) (fols 53r, l. 3–70v & 114r, l. 20–117av); 4) (fols 85r & 89r); 5) (fols 85v–86v & 89v–102av); 6) (fols 87r–88v & 103–114r, l. 19); 7) (fols 118r–127v). Several marginalia by contemporary hands of Mainz Charterhouse.

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials (fols 1r–21v) either parted, in red and blue, with fleuronnée decoration in red, blue and/or purple; or in red, with fleuronnée in pale brown and/or purple.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the 15th-cent. ex-libris inscriptions at the upper margin of fol. 1r: ‘Iste liber est Carthusiensium prope magunciam’ and, in the same hand, of 127v: ‘Iste liber est carthusiensium prope magunciam.’ Possibly identical with K I T in cat. ii.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris, dated 1638, at the lower half of fol. 1r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 302 Quarto Catalogue, col. 303 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 46

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1179–1193

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
